data.title: Awesome 8 Wild Cats
data.meta_description: Get pictures and fun facts about eight wild cats.
data.text:
Lion

Loudmouth

Please be respectful of copyright. Unauthorized use is prohibited.

An adult lion’s roar can be heard up to five miles away.

Tiger

Not a Copycat

Please be respectful of copyright. Unauthorized use is prohibited.

A tiger’s pattern is like a fingerprint—no two patterns of stripes are exactly the same.

Cheetah

Super-Charged

Please be respectful of copyright. Unauthorized use is prohibited.

A cheetah is the fastest land animal, reaching speeds over 60 miles per hour, and can pump out as many as four strides per second at top speed. They can accelerate faster than most cars!

Snow Leopard

Jump-Start

Please be respectful of copyright. Unauthorized use is prohibited.

Snow leopards can leap as far as 50 feet—the length of a humpback whale.

Clouded Leopard

Hanging Out

Please be respectful of copyright. Unauthorized use is prohibited.

These cats are excellent climbers. Using their large paws and sharp claws, they can even hang upside down beneath tree branches.

Jaguar

Jaw Power

Please be respectful of copyright. Unauthorized use is prohibited.

A jaguar’s jaws are strong enough to crack open tortoise shells—helping it get to one of its favorite treats.

Leopard

In the Trees

Please be respectful of copyright. Unauthorized use is prohibited.

Leopards can stalk their prey—including antelopes and gazelles—drag it up, and eat it all in trees. This keeps their food safe from scavengers like hyenas.

Cougar

Name Game

Please be respectful of copyright. Unauthorized use is prohibited.

Also known as mountain lions, panthers, and pumas, this secretive cat’s range stretches from the southern tip of South America up to the edge of the Yukon, a wild territory in northwest Canada.
